class_notes: OPUS waitlist is available at the beginning of add/drop/swap.  Prior completion of PSYC 110, 111, or AP/IB credit in psychology or equivalent. Cognitive neuroscience is a relatively new scientific field that focuses on understanding the structural and functional aspects of the brain that underlying complex cognitive processes. Driven by advancements in technology and statistical approaches, the field of cognitive neuroscience has expanded exponentially over the last few decades. The purpose of this course is to explore what we have learned about how the brain supports our ability to perceive through our senses, attend to and learn from our environment, and communicate with others.
course_description: Prerequisite: Psychology 110 or equivalent. An in-depth survey of the brain systems and mechanisms involved in perception, memory, awareness, communication, and other cognitive phenomena.
sections: Class Nbr: 3633, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 10-11:15a, Instructor: B. Yamasaki, Status: Open
